intro: Espeletia jimenez-quesadae, commonly known as the Jimenez-Quesada espeletia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and páramo ecosystems, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually broad and succulent, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are small and clustered, often displaying a mix of white, yellow, and green hues.
